qas.question: In what year did the Cold War begin?
How many nuclear weapons were tested in the Marshall Islands between 1946 and 1958?
What was the name of the United States' largest atmospheric nuclear test?
What was the yield of the Castle Bravo bombs in kilotons?
Which of the Marshall Islands was destroyed in a United States hydrogen bomb test?

context: During the early years of the Cold War from <a0_0>1946<a0_0/> to 1958, the United States tested <a1_0>67<a1_0/> nuclear weapons at its Pacific Proving Grounds located in the Marshall Islands, including the largest atmospheric nuclear test ever conducted by the U.S., code named <a2_0>Castle Bravo<a2_0/>. "The bombs had a total yield of <a3_0>108,496<a3_0/> kilotons, over 7,200 times more powerful than the atomic weapons used during World War II." With the 1952 test of the first U.S. hydrogen bomb, code named "Ivy Mike," the island of <a4_0>Elugelab<a4_0/> in the Enewetak atoll was destroyed. In 1956, the United States Atomic Energy Commission regarded the Marshall Islands as "by far the most contaminated place in the world."
